name: UIButton
comment: **[Experimental]** A simple button that extends [`UI`](#link) to track clicks and hovers.

signatures.comment: Create an UIButton. A button has 2 states, "clicks" (number) and "hover" (boolean), which you can access through [`UI.state`](#link) function. You may also create a new UIButton using one of the static helper like [`UI.fromRectangle`](#link) or [`UI.fromCircle`](#link).

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<PtLike> that defines the UI's appearance

parameters.name: shape
parameters.comment: specifies the shape of the Group

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: Optional default state object

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: Optional id string

accessors.name: group
accessors.comment: A group of Pts that defines this UI's shape.

accessors.name: id
accessors.comment: An unique id of the UI.

accessors.name: shape
accessors.comment: A string that describes this UI's shape.

signatures.comment: Continue to keep track of an actions even if it's not within this UI. Useful for hover-leave and drag-outside.

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: a string defined in [`UIPointerActions`](#link)

signatures.comment: Listen for UI events and trigger action handlers.

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: an action type. Can be one of UIPointerActions or a custom one.

parameters.name: p
parameters.comment: a point to check

parameters.name: evt
parameters.comment: a MouseEvent emitted by the browser (See [MDN docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent))

signatures.comment: Remove an event handler.

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: event type

parameters.name: which
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UI.on`](#link). If this is not defined, all handlers in this type will be removed.

signatures.comment: Remove an existing click handler
signatures.returns_comment: a boolean indicating whether the handler was removed successfully

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UIButton.onClick`](#link). If this is not defined, all handlers in this type will be removed.

signatures.comment: Remove an existing contextmenu handler
signatures.returns_comment: a boolean indicating whether the handler was removed successfully

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UIButton.onContextMenu`](#link). If this is not defined, all handlers in this type will be removed.

signatures.comment: Remove handlers for hover events.
signatures.returns_comment: an array of booleans indicating whether the handlers were removed successfully

parameters.name: enterID
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UI.onClick`](#link), or -1 to skip. If this is not defined, all handlers in this type will be removed.

parameters.name: leaveID
parameters.comment: an ID number returned by [`UI.onClick`](#link), or -1 to skip. If this is not defined, all handlers in this type will be removed.

signatures.comment: Add an event handler. Remember this UI will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`.
signatures.returns_comment: an id number that reference to this handler, for use in [`UI.off`](#link)

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: event type

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a [`UIHandler`](#link) callback function: `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string, evt:MouseEvent )`

signatures.comment: Add a new click handler. Remember this button will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`. If you want to track right clicks, you may also consider [`UIButton.onContextMenu`](#link).
signatures.returns_comment: an id number that refers to this handler, for use in [`UIButton.offClick`](#link) or [`UI.off`](#link).

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a [`UIHandler`](#link) callback function: `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string, evt:MouseEvent )`

signatures.comment: Add a new contextmenu handler. `contextmenu` is similar to right click, see the [MDN docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/contextmenu_event). Remember this button will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`. Also note that you may need to use `event.preventDefault()` in the callback function to prevent other events from triggering.
signatures.returns_comment: an id number that refers to this handler, for use in [`UIButton.offContextMenu`](#link) or [`UI.off`](#link).

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a [`UIHandler`](#link) callback function: `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string, evt:MouseEvent )`

signatures.comment: Add handlers for hover events. Remember this button will also need to be tracked for events via `UI.track`.
signatures.returns_comment: id numbers that refer to enter/leave handlers, for use in [`UIButton.offHover`](#link) or [`UI.off`](#link).

parameters.name: enter
parameters.comment: an optional [`UIHandler`](#link) function to handle when pointer enters hover. Eg, `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string, evt:MouseEvent )`

parameters.name: leave
parameters.comment: an optional [`UIHandler`](#link) function to handle when pointer exits hover. Eg, `fn( target:UI, pt:Pt, type:string, evt:MouseEvent )`

signatures.comment: Take a custom render function to render this UI.

parameters.name: fn
parameters.comment: a render function

signatures.comment: Get and/or set a specific UI state.

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: state's name

parameters.name: value
parameters.comment: optionally set a new value for this state.key

signatures.comment: Returns a string representation of this UI
Stop keeping track of this action

parameters.name: key
parameters.comment: an id returned by the [`UI.hold`](#link) function

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a Circle UI.

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<PtLike> with 2 Pt representing a circle

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: optional id string

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a Polygon UI.

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<PtLike> representing a polygon

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: optional id string

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a Rectangle UI.

parameters.name: group
parameters.comment: a Group or an Iterable<PtLike> with 2 Pt representing a rectangle

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

parameters.name: id
parameters.comment: optional id string

signatures.comment: A static helper function to create a new UI based on another UI.

parameters.name: ui
parameters.comment: base UI

parameters.name: states
parameters.comment: optional a state object keep track of custom states for this UI

signatures.comment: A static function to listen for a list of UIs. See also [`UI.listen`](#link).

parameters.name: uis
parameters.comment: an array of UI

parameters.name: type
parameters.comment: an action type. Can be one of `UIPointerActions` or a custom one.

parameters.name: p
parameters.comment: a point to check

parameters.name: evt
parameters.comment: a MouseEvent emitted by the browser (See [MDN docs](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/MouseEvent))
